Pre-Game Insights: Azerbaijan has a home advantage, and their recent win against Sweden could boost their confidence.
Sweden needs to win points to progress up the table, while Azerbaijan will be eager to maintain their position.
Sweden has recently suffered defensively away from home, while Azerbaijan has performed well at home.
Azerbaijan’s recent win against Sweden could give them a psychological edge over Sweden.
Sweden’s poor recent form could affect their morale and approach to the game.
Possible changes in lineup or strategy by the coaches could be decisive.
Weather conditions in Baku could favor the home side, accustomed to the local climate.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Azerbaijan has shown resiliency in their home games against Kazakhstan and Mongolia, managing to clinch two victories in their previous five games.
Sweden has struggled defensively and let up many goals in recent games, especially against elite opponents like Serbia and Portugal.
Azerbaijan’s draw against Bulgaria suggests that they can be unpredictable, making it hard to gauge their performance against stronger opponents like Sweden.
Sweden has a strong head-to-head record against Azerbaijan, suggesting that team has performed well in previous meetings.
Azerbaijan’s recent win against Sweden in November 2023 has created uncertainty surrounding the forthcoming game.
Others: The game will be played on September 5, 2024, at 16:00 UTC in the 31,200-seat Tofiq Bahramov Republican Stadium in Baku, Azerbaijan.
Berke B., a Hungarian referee with expertise and authority, will officiate the game.

Azerbaijan’s probable lineup includes Mahammadaliyev (GK), Mammadov (DF), Mustafazada (DF), Kryvotsiuk (DF), Cafarquliyev (DF), Sheydayev (MF), Isayev (MF), Diniyev (MF), Bayramov (MF), Mahmudov (FW), Dadashov (FW).
Sweden’s probable lineup includes Olsen (GK), Wahlqvist (DF), Lindelof (DF), Helander (DF), Sema (DF), Svanberg (MF), Cajuste (MF), Gustafson (MF), Forsberg (MF), Gyokeres (FW), Kulusevski (FW).
